page.title: 12"Bowcombe"-Local News.
page.content: {"'Big cat' may have claimed fresh {victim"}is the headline describing the latest sighting of the mysterious animal which over the past two and a half years has become the Island's mystery creature. In this latest incident, Mr. R. Kingswell of Rowborough Farm found the carcase of the second of two lambs discovered in circumstances quite unlike any such previous lamb death. "The lamb was too big for a dog, fox or badger to kill, and it was eaten. It must have been something pretty big to kill it". He took it to the proprietor of the Island's zoo at Sandown who admitted that it could have been a large panther-like animal. An animal fitting this description was also spotted by a worker at Cheverton Farm, who followed it in a Land-Rover and described it as "a large cat with sharp pointed ears".
